lines.text: Po morzu ludzi się często przechadzam, to dla mnie jak Jesus Walk
lines.translation: I often walk through the sea of people, it's like Jesus Walk for me
lines.grammar: Verbs: się (1sg ending -ę); przechadzam (prefix prze- hints perfective/directional) (present 1sg). Prepositions/case: po + locative/accusative depending on motion. Meaning: 'I often walk through the sea of people, it's like Jesus Walk for me'. Explain how aspect/prefix changes meaning and how case follows these prepositions.

lines.text: Na scenie mordo się czuję jak Shazam, bo kiedy tu składam to jakby przechodził mnie prąd
lines.translation: I feel like Shazam on stage, because when I put it together it's like electricity is going through me.
lines.grammar: Verbs: się (1sg ending -ę); czuję (1sg ending -ę). Prepositions/case: na + accusative (motion) / locative (location). Meaning: 'I feel like Shazam on stage, because when I put it together it's like electricity is going through me.'. Explain how aspect/prefix changes meaning and how case follows these prepositions.

lines.text: Schowaj pretensje w kieszeń swą, hajs się nie mieści w kieszeniach jakbym otworzył sezam
lines.translation: Put your resentment in your pocket, the money doesn't fit in my pockets like I opened sesame seeds
lines.grammar: Verbs: się (1sg ending -ę); sezam (present 1sg). Prepositions/case: w/we + locative for location, accusative for motion into. Meaning: 'Put your resentment in your pocket, the money doesn't fit in my pockets like I opened sesame seeds'. Explain how aspect/prefix changes meaning and how case follows these prepositions.

lines.text: Jadę z klubu do hotelu i ze składem walę melanż
lines.translation: I'm going from the club to the hotel and having a party with the squad
lines.grammar: Verbs: jadę (1sg ending -ę); składem (present 1sg). Prepositions/case: z/ze + genitive for "from/out of"; do + genitive for motion toward. Meaning: 'I'm going from the club to the hotel and having a party with the squad'. Explain how aspect/prefix changes meaning and how case follows these prepositions.

lines.text: A od ludzi pozdrowienia mordo mam jak Ave Cezar
lines.translation: And from people, my face is greeted with greetings like Ave Cezar
lines.grammar: Verbs: mam (present 1sg). Prepositions/case: od + genitive for "from/because of". Meaning: 'And from people, my face is greeted with greetings like Ave Cezar'. Explain how aspect/prefix changes meaning and how case follows these prepositions.

lines.text: Mam tu sporo do zrobienia, więc się o mnie ziomek nie martw, bo Ostatni Ziomal ostatniego słowa nie powiedział
lines.translation: I have a lot to do here, so don't worry about me, bro, because the Last Bro hasn't said his last word.
lines.grammar: Verbs: mam (present 1sg); się (1sg ending -ę). Prepositions/case: do + genitive for motion toward; o + locative/accusative depending on phrase. lines.text: Tam poznałem Żabę, od wtedy ssak gada z płazem
lines.translation: There I met the Frog, since then the mammal has been talking to the amphibian
lines.grammar: Verbs: tam (present 1sg); poznałem (prefix po- hints perfective/directional) (past 1sg). Prepositions/case: od + genitive for "from/because of"; z/ze + genitive for "from/out of". Meaning: 'There I met the Frog, since then the mammal has been talking to the amphibian'. Explain how aspect/prefix changes meaning and how case follows these prepositions.

lines.text: A z płazem pięć koła w pingla przegrałem, przepierdoliłem, przejebałem
lines.translation: And I lost five rounds of ping pong with an amphibian, I fucked it up, I fucked it up
lines.grammar: Verbs: płazem (present 1sg); przegrałem (prefix prze- hints perfective/directional) (past 1sg). Prepositions/case: z/ze + genitive for "from/out of"; w/we + locative for location, accusative for motion into. Meaning: 'And I lost five rounds of ping pong with an amphibian, I fucked it up, I fucked it up'. Explain how aspect/prefix changes meaning and how case follows these prepositions.

lines.text: Tyle kilometrów najebałem, okrążyłem ze dwa razy kulę ziemską
lines.translation: I've driven so many kilometers, I've circled the globe twice
lines.grammar: Verbs: najebałem (prefix na- hints perfective/directional) (past 1sg); okrążyłem (prefix o- hints perfective/directional) (past 1sg). Prepositions/case: z/ze + genitive for "from/out of". Meaning: 'I've driven so many kilometers, I've circled the globe twice'. Explain how aspect/prefix changes meaning and how case follows these prepositions.
